author: 0xjepsen
content: I think there are some serious problems with on-chain auctions that date back to milgroms initial theory of auctions. https://milgrom.people.stanford.edu/publications/, specifically that the incentive for the auction to go off-chain (like we have seen with PGA (first price) -> bundles (sealed bid)), and this creates an env for auctions of auctions which molgrom has shown can't succeed.

author: 0xjepsen
content: also all of this is talk about fair ordering has been well studied in the context of TCP. The entire field of queuing theory is focused on fair ordering.
